task: Write a short, high-converting newsletter subject line for a weekly productivity-focused newsletter targeting busy professionals who use Microsoft 365, based on the information from task_input
rules: Use the Curiosity Gap technique to hint at the value without giving everything away.
Address a real pain point or desire of the target audience.
Avoid fluff, hype, or clichés like 'work smarter, not harder'.
Use natural, real-life language your audience would use.
Reflect the tone of the newsletter: clear, calm, practical, and human.
Return only one subject line—short, punchy, and focused.
Do not use clickbait or vague teaser lines.
Avoid unnecessary punctuation like exclamation marks or all caps.
Use verbs and specific language to signal transformation or outcome.
Whenever possible, tie the subject line to a story or takeaway from the newsletter.
If relevant, mirror the phrasing of high-performing YouTube video titles or headlines used in the past.
